intro: Holboellia khasiana, commonly known as the Khasi holboellia, is a flowering plant native to the northeastern regions of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing habit. The plant features opposite, elliptical leaves that are usually glabrous, and it produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. Holboellia khasiana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
